content: fortune s shawlette was inspired by the ubiquitous corner to corner stitch aka the diagonal box stitch but of course i had to add my own twist to the idea creating a lacier more open summer ready stitch pattern the result is gorgeous and just right for year round - bunch it up for warmth stretch it out for a light as air layer on the shoulders if you want a bigger shawl you could try a thicker yarn or even use the same yarn and add more row - it s super easy and once you get started it ll fly off the hook this pattern is available for free on mooglyblog com or you can purchase the pdf here on ravelry fortune s shawlette was inspired by the ubiquitous corner to corner stitch aka the diagonal box stitch but of course i had to add my own twist to the idea creating a lacier more open summer ready stitch pattern the result is gorgeous and just right for year round - bunch it up for warmth stretch it out for a light as air layer on the shoulders if you want a bigger shawl you could try a thicker yarn or even use the same yarn and add more row - it s super easy and once you get started it ll fly off the hook
